title: Geographical Names
description: Master the Canadian conventions for geographical names and places

questions.stem: Which is the correct way to write Canadian province abbreviations in formal documents?

options.label: Both B and C are acceptable

questions.rationale: Use either the two-letter postal abbreviations (AB, BC) or spell out the full names in formal writing.

questions.stem: Complete the proper form of this Canadian place name:
questions.hint: Consider the official names and proper punctuation.
questions.rationale: St. John's (with apostrophe) is the capital of Newfoundland and Labrador (full provincial name).

questions.stem: Find the error in this Canadian place name:
questions.text: The conference will be held in Charlottetown, P.E.I. next month.
questions.rationale: In formal writing, use either 'PE' or 'Prince Edward Island' rather than the old abbreviation 'P.E.I.'

questions.stem: Match each international place with its correct Canadian English form:
questions.rationale: Use current internationally recognized names rather than outdated forms.

questions.stem: How should foreign place names be treated in Canadian English?

options.label: Always use the original language form
Use established English forms when they exist

questions.rationale: Use established English forms (like Rome for Roma) but respect current official names for newer places.

questions.stem: Arrange these place names by preference in Canadian writing:
questions.rationale: Prefer established English forms, then current official names, then former names only in historical context.

questions.stem: When should generic geographic terms be capitalized?

options.label: Always, to show respect for places
Only when part of the official name
Never, as they are common nouns

questions.rationale: Capitalize generic terms only when they're part of the official proper name (Lake Superior vs. the lake).

questions.text: We visited ______ ______ and then drove along the ______.
questions.hint: Consider when the generic term is part of the proper name vs. a general reference.
questions.rationale: 'Lake Ontario' is the proper name, but 'the lake' is a general reference.

questions.text: The Rocky Mountains are beautiful, but I prefer the Mountains in the east.
questions.rationale: When used generally (not as part of a proper name), 'mountains' should be lowercase.

questions.stem: Match each Canadian territory/province with its correct postal abbreviation:
questions.rationale: Canadian postal abbreviations are standardized two-letter codes without periods.

questions.stem: In formal addresses, which abbreviation style is preferred?

options.label: Both B and C are correct

questions.rationale: Use either official postal abbreviations or full names, but avoid old-style abbreviations with periods.

questions.stem: Rank these address formats by formality:
questions.rationale: Full names are most formal, postal codes are standard, old abbreviations are outdated.

questions.stem: How should Indigenous place names be handled in Canadian writing?
questions.rationale: Respect current Indigenous naming preferences and official designations when they exist.

questions.stem: When writing about Indigenous territories, use ______ language that acknowledges their relationship to the land.
questions.rationale: Use respectful, current terminology that acknowledges Indigenous sovereignty and relationships to traditional territories.

questions.stem: When should directional terms be capitalized?

options.label: Always, as they indicate specific places
When they refer to specific regions
Never, as they are common adjectives

questions.rationale: Capitalize directional terms when they refer to specific, well-recognized regions (the West, Northern Ontario).

questions.stem: Find the error in directional term usage:
questions.text: We drove North to the northern part of the province.
questions.rationale: Simple directions are lowercase ('drove north'), while regional references may be capitalized.

questions.stem: Match each usage with its correct capitalization:
questions.rationale: Capitalize when referring to recognized regions, lowercase for simple directions or general references.
